attributes.action: Please stop using the phrase "the right honourable"  in the House Of Commons
attributes.background: The EU referendum has shown that several MPs are quite happy to knowing mislead the general public with a tissue of lies so the general address of "the right honourable" is wholly inappropriate. Just referring to them as "the MP for" would be correct.

rejection.details:
Not all MPs are entitled to use the title "Right honourable". This is a title that may be used by members of the Privy Council. You can find out more about the Privy Council here:

http://privycouncil.independent.gov.uk/

Not all members of the Privy Council are MPs.

During debates, MPs refer to other MPs (if they are not members of the Privy Council) as "the honourable gentlement/lady" or "my honourable friend".

You could start a new petition calling for all MPs to be known as "the MP for" instead.
